Redemption for the Lemurs...
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Monster Types: Hopper: Redemption for the Lemurs...
By PezCat on Monday, May 8, 2000 - 02:45 pm:

Well, Over the weekend I bit the bullet and raised a Hopper. I admit it, I raised it for 2 reasons:
1) I have decided that I will try every primary monster breed at least once, and 2) I wanted the
Undine Slate. I was not looking forward to raising this little guy

However, Lemming, (a Springer... Hopper/Metalner) surprised the hell out of me. The little
runt made S-Class and went undefeated (53-0, 31 KO's). Through some miracle he K.O.'d his
way through B-Class, and with the exception of Arculon, did the same in A-Class. His speed
didn't go up like I would have liked (only made like 650+ with it), but his power was decent
for a Hopper (450+), and his skill did max out. Not bad for a first-genner off a CD.

This does redeem the little runt in my eyes, as I dreaded actually trying to raise one for much
of his life. I don't think I'll keep the Hopper line going on my game (I got every move except
Flick Combo, I think, if that's the right move), but he was very worthy... Thank God for 3 Jump
Blows!

PezCat

By Earl on Monday, May 8, 2000 - 05:43 pm:

Raise a Hopper/Mock, early in the game, and it wouldn't die... it lived for 6 years!! and i did everything to kill it, after i got the hot springs, he was about 3 years old, and after that he stats went up only 3 or 4 on a good stat, but he wouldn't die. i made him stresed and skinny, he got sick, injured and run away but he still wouldn't die!! it turns that he was the longest living monster i've ever had

By Nate Railsback on Friday, May 12, 2000 - 03:20 pm:

To get Flick Combo your Hopper has to be evil and have used Rapid Flick 50+ times. Congratulations on raising a steller Hopper! By the way, the reason its speed wasn't as good as other Hoppers was because Metalners are horrible at that stat. But I bet Defense went up pretty well on him.

Also, I'm glad to see someone else knows what a lemur is. I called my champion Snow Hopper Lemuri, and no one seemed to know where I got that name...
